You are a taxonomy expert. Review this skills hierarchy sanity check.

Current state: 27 top-level categories (we want 10-12)

| Category | Children | Issue |
|----------|----------|-------|
| technology | 115 | OK |
| people_and_communication | 82 | OK |
| compliance_and_risk | 62 | OK |

| specialized_knowledge | 31 | OK |
| DATABASE_MANAGEMENT | 27 | ALL_CAPS, should be under technology? |
| data_and_analytics | 27 | Keep as top-level? |
| corporate_culture | 20 | Keep or merge into people? |
| finance_and_investment | 15 | Keep as top-level? |
| user_experience_(ux) | 15 | Keep as top-level? |
| client_relationships | 11 | Merge into people? |
| sales_and_marketing | 10 | Keep or merge into business? |
| OPERATIONAL_EFFICIENCY | 5 | ALL_CAPS, merge into business? |
| culture_and_collaboration | 4 | Duplicate of corporate_culture? |
| clientservices | 4 | Merge into client_relationships? |
| reporting_compliance | 4 | Merge into compliance? |
| roi_optimization | 3 | Merge into finance? |
| regulatory_compliance | 3 | Duplicate of compliance_and_risk? |
| employee_benefits | 3 | Merge into business? |
| information_technology | 3 | Duplicate of technology? |
| capital_markets | 3 | Merge into finance? |
| analytical_skills | 3 | Merge into data? |
| quality_assurance | 3 | Keep or merge? |
| sales_campaigns | 3 | Merge into sales? |
| marketing_and_sales | 3 | Duplicate of sales_and_marketing? |
| processimprovement | 3 | Merge into business? |

TASK: Recommend exactly 10-12 top-level categories. For each of the 27, say KEEP or MERGE INTO [target].

Based on your current state, I would recommend consolidating some of the categories to achieve a more manageable number while maintaining clarity and relevance. Here's my suggested hierarchy:

1. Technology (KEEP)
2. People & Communication (KEEP)
3. Compliance & Risk Management (KEEP)
4. Project Management & Product Development (KEEP)
5. Business Operations (KEEP)
6. Specialized Knowledge (KEEP)
7. Data & Analytics (KEEP)
8. Finance & Investment (KEEP)
9. User Experience (UX) (KEEP)
10. Sales, Marketing, and Client Relationships (MERGE INTO Business)
11. Corporate Culture and Collaboration (KEEP - combine with Corporate Culture if necessary)
12. Operational Efficiency, Employee Benefits, Regulatory Compliance, and Reporting Compliance (MERGE INTO Compliance & Risk Management)
13. ROI Optimization, Capital Markets, and Analytical Skills (MERGE INTO Finance & Investment)
14. Quality Assurance (KEEP - but consider merging with Specialized Knowledge if necessary)
15. Process Improvement (MERGE INTO Business Operations)

This reorganization leaves out a few categories, such as DATABASE_MANAGEMENT and OPERATIONAL_EFFICIENCY. You might choose to combine these with related top-level categories, or you could consider adding them under a more general "Technology" category if the number of subcategories becomes too large.

This structure should result in 12 top-level categories while ensuring a clear and concise taxonomy for your skills hierarchy.
